id you don't have anywhere to go, does that mean you no longer wish to serv=
e him?" Perseus asked, sitting up in his chair and resting his chin on one =
arm, as if deep in thought.

ll he

ere back in
    > > > > place.

the narrow corridor ramps, leading the 
    the lowest
    > > > > level of=
 the base. At the holding cells, he pushed a button 
    on the panel
    >=
 > > > next to battered blast doors and it slid open, revealing the

mpletely
    > > > > trashed holding cell and security office. He continued=
 to

    > > > > secondary cell and knocked on the bars.
=
    > > > >
    > > > > "Blacknightmare? I apologize for making you wait so=
 long. 
    We have
    > > > > some things we need to discuss." he said ca=
lmly.
